contentrichtext.text: '''Oliver Cromwell Hartley''' (1823–1859) was an [[United States|American]] lawyer from [[Galveston, Texas|Galveston]], [[Texas]]. He served as the [[Law report|reporter]] for the [[Texas Supreme Court|state’s Supreme Court]] from 1846 to 1859, and published the first codification of state laws in ''"A Digest of the Laws of Texas"'' in 1850. Hartley also served in the Texas state House of Representatives in 1851 and 1852. He died in Galveston on February 13, 1859.<br /> [[Hartley County, Texas]] is named for him and his brother Rufus K.
